channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Israel says it struck gunmen attacking Druze in Syria after deadly clashes
item.description: The strikes were south of Damascus, where Syrian security forces say they are battling gunmen from the religious minority.

item.title: Life inside Iraq's 'Forbidden Zone' controlled by Turkey
item.description: Turkey has been building military bases on Iraqi territory, the BBC finds, raising fears of an occupation.

item.title: Israeli forces arrest prominent Palestinian journalist in West Bank
item.description: Ali al-Samoudi, who has worked extensively with Western media, was detained during what the Israeli military said were counter-terrorism raids.

item.title: Gaza medic detained during deadly Israeli attack released, Red Crescent says
item.description: Assad al-Nassasra was missing for weeks following last month's attack, in which 15 emergency workers were killed by Israeli troops.

item.title: Iran blames 'negligence' for port blast as death toll rises to 70
item.description: The interior minister said "some individuals deemed responsible" for Saturday's blast at Shahid Rajaee are being questioned.

item.title: Israel spy chief to step down after row with PM exposes deepening rifts
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Shin Bet head Ronen Bar accused each other of lies or inaccuracies in sworn depositions.

item.title: Dozens of African migrants killed in US strike on Yemen, Houthis say
item.description: Houthi-run media report the bodies of 68 people have been recovered from a migrant detention centre in Saada.

item.title: UN's top court begins hearings on Israel's legal duties towards Palestinians
item.description: Dozens of countries will give evidence at the ICJ hearings, which Israel has labelled a "circus".

item.title: Mourning turns to anger in Iran after massive port explosion kills 40
item.description: A blame game begins amid reports solid fuel intended for ballistic missiles may have been improperly stored.

item.title: Israel launches air strike on Beirut
item.description: Israel said it hit a Hezbollah missile store. The Lebanese presidency urged the US and France to press Israel to cease its attacks.

item.title: Qatar claims slight progress towards ceasefire in Gaza
item.description: But the Qatari PM says there was still no "answer for the ultimate question: how to end this war".

item.title: Israel's muted response to Pope Francis's death signals tensions over Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office has sent condolences four days after the Pope's death.

item.title: UN agency runs out of food aid in Gaza after Israeli blockade
item.description: The UN agency has delivered its last supplies to meals kitchens, which it warns will run out of food in the coming days.

item.title: Israeli military admits its troops killed UN worker in Gaza Strip
item.description: Israel had previously denied its troops were responsible for the killing of a UN worker with tank fire on 19 March.

item.title: Abbas calls Hamas 'sons of dogs' and demands release of Gaza hostages
item.description: Palestinian Authority president says that Hamas has given Israel "excuses" to continue the Gaza war.

item.title: Jordan bans Muslim Brotherhood after arrests over attack plots
item.description: It is not clear how the ban will affect the Brotherhood's political arm, which is the largest opposition group in parliament.

item.title: 'Very, very toxic': The risk of asbestos in Gaza's rubble
item.description: The mineral, once widely-used, releases toxic fibres into the air when disturbed that can cling to the lungs and cause cancer.

item.title: Anti-Hamas protests on rise in Gaza as group's iron grip slips
item.description: Gazan civilians are losing their fear of Hamas, openly criticising the group on the streets and online.

item.title: We're orphans now, say Gaza Catholics the Pope called daily
item.description: Pope Francis had a close relationship with Gaza's tiny Christian community and used his last address to call for a ceasefire.

item.title: 'It's really hard to have any hope': Gaza doctor describes daily struggle
item.description: The BBC joins a GP in Gaza as she sees dozens of patients, struggling to treat them with a dwindling supply of drugs.

item.title: What is Iran's nuclear programme and what does the US want?
item.description: Donald Trump has suggested Iran could face military action if it does not agree to a new nuclear deal.

item.title: Schools in Beirut suburb fear return to war after new Israeli strikes
item.description: Students, staff, and parents alike are traumatised by what has happened and the destruction that surrounds them.

item.title: 'We collected his body instead of celebrating Eid,' says mother of Gaza medic killed by Israel
item.description: The mother of a Palestinian killed in an IDF attack on emergency vehicles tells the BBC of her loss.

item.title: 'Part of us is still in Gaza': Freed Israeli hostages fight for a new ceasefire
item.description: Hostages released earlier this year are adding their powerful voices to calls for a deal to bring home those still held by Hamas.

item.title: Chemical burns, assaults, electric shocks - Gazans tell BBC of torture in Israeli detention
item.description: Interviews with five men held in the months after the Hamas attacks reveal allegations of violence and abuse, adding to reports of misconduct by military and prison staff.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Syria a challenge to Turkey
item.description: Israeli air strikes on bases in Syria are a warning to Turkey to keep its military assets away.

item.title: Hezbollah at crossroads after blows from war weaken group
item.description: The BBC's Hugo Bachega explores the future for Hezbollah in the wake of Israel's devastating attacks.

item.title: Gaza bakeries shut and painkillers on ration after month of Israeli blockade
item.description: Many Palestinians say they are going hungry after Israel stopped all aid deliveries to put pressure on Hamas.

item.title: Survivor challenges Israeli account of attack on Gaza paramedics
item.description: Palestinian paramedic Munther Abed rejects Israel's assertion that the vehicles approached troops with their lights off.

item.title: Wounded Palestinians dying over lack of supplies, US surgeon who worked in Gaza says
item.description: Dr Mark Perlmutter says doctors are working without soap, antibiotics or x-ray facilities, as Israel has resumed its offensive against Hamas.

item.title: 'I was afraid for my life': At the scene of the attack on Palestinian Oscar winner
item.description: The Palestinian Oscar winner's West Bank home was attacked by Israeli settlers. Ballal's co-director says his acclaim "does not help us on the ground".

item.title: The Indian scholar arrested in US over father-in-law's Hamas link
item.description: Friends and family of Badar Khan Suri in India say they are shocked by the terror charges against him.

item.title: 'We will rescue anyone': BBC accompanies Syria's White Helmets after deadly attacks
item.description: The BBC accompanies the civil defence group as they respond to violence in Syria's coastal region.

item.title: Is the war starting again in Gaza?
item.description: Is the truce finished after Israeli air strikes across Gaza?

item.title: British daughter of Gaza hostage says burying father 'incredibly meaningful'
item.description: Sharone Lifschitz said it was important all families were reunited with their relatives, both dead and alive

item.title: Who is Mahmoud Khalil, Palestinian student activist facing US deportation?
item.description: The Columbia University graduate had a key role in student protests over Gaza. Trump said his arrest was the first of "many to come".

item.title: Chaos on roads as residents flee rampant Israel wildfires
item.description: Buildings burn and land is scorched as wildfires spread outside of Jerusalem.

item.title: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
item.description: At least four people have been killed and 500 more injured in Bandar Abbas.

item.title: Thousands march through Auschwitz commemorating liberation
item.description: Holocaust survivors were part of the crowds taking part in the annual 'March of the Living', 80 years after the camp was liberated.

item.title: Watch: What we learned from Trump's meeting with Netanyahu
item.description: Netanyahu is the first world leader to visit the White House since the US president announced tariffs on global trading partners.
